topics.body:
"@Too_Offensive":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/551391356368722d97f90500#post_551391356368722d97f90500
It wouldn't be so bad if the chimera was still sapient and had thumbs or such, but christ even still it would be really bad.

I know what I'm saying is controversial but I totally agree with what scar did because there was no way that she could ever live even close to a normal life or even function.  Her higher brain functions gone.  Thumbs gone.  Ability to use the bathroom on your own gone.  Ability to learn new things and be able to emotionally develop gone.

Let's say she wasn't killed then when she became twenty years old she would still be mentally the same.

It would have been a lot less worse, but still pretty bad, if he kept her higher brain functions at least.  If he kept her higher brain functions then theoretically a philosopher stone could have given a more human body and helped her lead a normal life, but no her life as it stands was utterly destroyed.

The sad part is though I think they are equally as sad I cannot argue with that.

Because even though Hughes died he was an Adult. And he was in the line of work that he knew would probably get him killed.

Nina on the other hand was a Child....Who _loved_ her father. 

And he betrayed her. And got her killed.

topics.body:
"@Carcass Strife":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/551394cd6368722791312700#post_551394cd6368722791312700
Even 4chan doesn't joke about it.


"@Thanotos Omega":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/551394156368725603951f00#post_551394156368725603951f00
Or he could have started with testing on human tissue and organs and then worked his way up.

He could have gone, "Hey I'm thinking of using animal organs for transplants; I need access to organs".  If he had gone that route and shown that animal organs could be used as organ transplants then everyone would have given him grant money, but no he skipped fucking every step in animal testing and went right to human testing.
